intro: Clarionea pilifera, commonly known as the featherleaf clarionea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
